Article.Abstract: The 10-kDa protein Ag of Mycobacterium leprae, a human GroES hsp10 cognate, is a major T cell Ag in human leprosy infection. We investigated the mechanism for T cell responsiveness to this Ag according to the trimolecular interaction between T cell, peptide, and Ag-presenting element. This research was accomplished by mapping T cell epitopes in leprosy patients and correlating these responses with peptide-MHC binding affinities. We found that the majority of tuberculoid leprosy patients responded to peptides corresponding to residues 25-39 and 28-42. Truncation analysis of these peptides mapped the exact epitope to be within the overlapping region comprising residues 28-39. Responsiveness was correlated with the HLA-DRB5*0101 allele, which bound the peptides with moderate affinity. This allele is linked to HLA-DR2, which is associated with the resistant form of leprosy. Therefore, T cell responsiveness in tuberculoid leprosy may be mediated by the ability of HLA-DRB5*0101 to bind and present peptides of the immunodominant 10-kDa Ag.
Article.ArticleTitle: Determinants of T cell reactivity to the Mycobacterium leprae GroES homologue.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Microbiology and Immunology, University of California Los Angeles School of Medicine, 90095, USA.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Alleles; Amino Acid Sequence; Antigens, Bacterial(immunology); Chaperonin 10(genetics; immunology); Clone Cells; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology); HLA-DR Antigens(genetics; immunology); HLA-DRB5 Chains; Humans; Molecular Sequence Data; Mycobacterium leprae(immunology); Sequence Homology, Amino Acid; T-Lymphocytes(immunology)

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from twelve patients with tuberculoid leprosy.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from patients with tuberculoid leprosy were initially screened using M. leprae sonicates and pooled peptides to reveal positive reactivity, and then positive peptides were further identified from within those pools. Two of the twelve patients tested responded to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from healthy donors who were PPD negative.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: One of the six healthy, PPD negative controls subjects responded to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from twelve patients with tuberculoid leprosy.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from patients with tuberculoid leprosy were initially screened using M. leprae sonicates and pooled peptides to reveal positive reactivity, and then positive peptides were further identified from within those pools. One of the twelve patients tested responded to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from twelve patients with lepromatous leprosy.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from patients with lepromatous leprosy were initially screened using M. leprae sonicates and pooled peptides to reveal positive reactivity, and then positive peptides were further identified from within those pools. One of the 5 patients tested responded to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from twelve patients with tuberculoid leprosy.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from patients with tuberculoid leprosy were initially screened using M. leprae sonicates and pooled peptides to reveal positive reactivity, and then positive peptides were further identified from within those pools. Two of the twelve patients tested responded to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from healthy donors who were PPD negative.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: One of the six healthy, PPD negative donors responded positively to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from twelve patients with tuberculoid leprosy. T cell clone 10A3 was derived from the lesion of one patient. T cells were cultured and expanded in vitro bi-weekly with IL-2, irradiated autologous feeder cells and M. leprae 10kDa antigen.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A T cell clone derived from the lesion of a tuberculoid leprosy patient produced IFNg in response to the epitope.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMCs were isolated from twelve patients with tuberculoid leprosy.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: PBMCs from patients with tuberculoid leprosy were initially screened using M. leprae sonicates and pooled peptides to reveal positive reactivity, and then positive peptides were further identified from within those pools. Six of the twelve patients tested responded to the epitope. Truncation analysis identified the minimal reactive peitope as LVIPENAKEKPQ.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The peptide as defined by the authors failed to generate an exact BLAST in GenBank. The peptide that exists for positions 1-15 of accession P24301 is MAKVKIKPLEDKILV.

The epitope bound with high affinty to DRB5*0101. Values represent the relative binding affinity of each truncated peptide to DRB5*0101 to the immunodminant p28-42.
